Line 53: Line 53:
==A-6 Intruder==
==A-6 Intruder==
  +
[[File:Flight of the intruder.jpg|thumb|left|A-6 Intruder on the DVD cover of [[Flight of the Intruder]]]]
The 1991 film ''[[Flight of the Intruder]]'' centered around two [[naval aviator]]s during the Vietnam War who take their [[Grumman A-6 Intruder]] on an unauthorized bombing raid on Hanoi, from the [[Stephen Coonts]] novel of the same name.<ref name="Canby">{{cite news|url= http://movies.nytimes.com/movie/17804/Flight-of-the-Intruder/overview |title=Flight of the Intruder |last=Canby |first=Vincent |publisher=New York Times |accessdate=19 January 2010}}</ref>
The 1991 film ''[[Flight of the Intruder]]'' centered around two [[naval aviator]]s during the Vietnam War who take their [[Grumman A-6 Intruder]] on an unauthorized bombing raid on Hanoi, from the [[Stephen Coonts]] novel of the same name.<ref name="Canby">{{cite news|url= http://movies.nytimes.com/movie/17804/Flight-of-the-Intruder/overview |title=Flight of the Intruder |last=Canby |first=Vincent |publisher=New York Times |accessdate=19 January 2010}}</ref>
  +
<br clear="all" />
==A-10 Thunderbolt II==
==A-10 Thunderbolt II==
  +
[[File:Wingblade-movie.jpg|thumb|left|''[[Wingblade]]'' transformer as an A-10]]
The evil [[Gobots]] character [[Bad Boy (Gobots)|Bad Boy]] and the heroic Transformers character [[Powerglide (Transformers)|Powerglide]] both disguise themselves as [[Fairchild Republic A-10 Thunderbolt II]]s.<ref name="PowerGlide">{{cite web|url= http://www.toysrus.com/product/index.jsp?productId=3099663 |title= Transformers Universe Ultra Class - PowerGlide |accessdate= 2010-02-23 |last= Toys'R'Us |authorlink= |year= 2010}}</ref>
The evil [[Gobots]] character [[Bad Boy (Gobots)|Bad Boy]] and the heroic Transformers character [[Powerglide (Transformers)|Powerglide]] both disguise themselves as [[Fairchild Republic A-10 Thunderbolt II]]s.<ref name="PowerGlide">{{cite web|url= http://www.toysrus.com/product/index.jsp?productId=3099663 |title= Transformers Universe Ultra Class - PowerGlide |accessdate= 2010-02-23 |last= Toys'R'Us |authorlink= |year= 2010}}</ref>
Line 61: Line 64:
A-10s were featured as the aircraft used by the human resistance to combat the machines of Skynet in the 2009 film ''[[Terminator Salvation]]''.<ref name=Salvation>{{cite video |people= [[McG|Nichol, Joseph McGinty]], Director |date= 2009 |title= Terminator Salvation |url= |medium= film |publisher= |location= United States |archiveurl=|archivedate= |accessdate= |time= |id= |isbn= |oclc= |quote= |ref= }}</ref>
A-10s were featured as the aircraft used by the human resistance to combat the machines of Skynet in the 2009 film ''[[Terminator Salvation]]''.<ref name=Salvation>{{cite video |people= [[McG|Nichol, Joseph McGinty]], Director |date= 2009 |title= Terminator Salvation |url= |medium= film |publisher= |location= United States |archiveurl=|archivedate= |accessdate= |time= |id= |isbn= |oclc= |quote= |ref= }}</ref>
  +

==A-26/B-26 Invader==
Line 68: Line 72:
==A6M Zero==
==A6M Zero==
â
The [[Mitsubishi A6M Zero]] was featured in the movies ''[[The Final Countdown (film)|The Final Countdown]]'',<ref name="Air and Space">{{cite web|url=http://www.airspacemag.com/flight-today/popculture.html|title=Star Quality |date=September 1, 2006|publisher=Air & Space Magazine|accessdate=11 January 2010}}</ref> ''[[Pearl Harbor (film)|Pearl Harbor]]'',<ref name="Persall">{{cite web|url=http://www.sptimes.com/News/052701/news_pf/Floridian/More_romance_than_his.shtml|title=More romance than history|last=Persall|first=Steve|date=May 27, 2001|publisher=St. Petersburg Times|accessdate=11 January 2010}}</ref><ref name="Wilonsky">{{cite web|url=http://www.houstonpress.com/2001-05-24/film/bora-bora-bora/ |title=Bora! Bora! Bora! |last=Wilonsky |first=Robert|date=May 24, 2001|publisher=Houston Press|accessdate=11 January 2010}}</ref> and ''[[Tora! Tora! Tora!]]''.<ref name="Murray">{{cite web|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=wyYhAAAAIBAJ&sjid=ZnoEAAAAIBAJ&pg=2871,98636&dq=zero+tora-tora-tora&hl=en |title=Texas Air Museum Takes Shape |last=Murray |first=Joe |date=June 11, 1990 |publisher=Sarasota Herald-Tribune|pages=11A|accessdate=11 January 2010}}</ref> The Zero was also depicted in the 1976 film ''[[Midway (film)|Midway]]''; however real Zeros were not used. Modified T-6 Texans were used in both ''Tora! Tora! Tora!'' and ''Midway'' to depict A6M2 Type 21 Zero fighters, and some footage from the former was reused in the latter.<ref>[http://www.tcm.com/tcmdb/title.jsp?stid=414244&category=Trivia Trivia for Midway(1976)]</ref><ref>[http://www.warbirdinformationexchange.org/wix/wixdownloads.html Warbird Information Exchange - Downloads]</ref><ref>[http://www.december7.com/1941/Classic_Movie_Planes/ TORA, TORA, TORA! I Saw Pearl Harbor Bombed in '69]</ref> One [[Mitsubishi A6M Zero#A6M5 Type 0 Model 52|Type 52]] Zero, reportedly the only airworthy copy in the world, was used in ''Pearl Harbor''.<ref>Bruckheimer, Jerry, Bay, Michael, and Wallace, Randall. ''Pearl Harbor: The Movie and the Moment''. Hyperion, 2001.</ref>
+
[[File:ToraToraTora1970.png|thumb|left|A6M Zeros on the DVD cover of [[Tora! Tora! Tora!]]]]
  +
[[File:Midway movie poster.jpg|thumb|left|A6M Zeroes can be scene here on the DVD cover of [[Midway (film)|Midway]]]]
  +
The [[Mitsubishi A6M Zero]] was featured in the movies ''[[The Final Countdown (film)|The Final Countdown]]'',<ref name="Air and Space">{{cite web|url=http://www.airspacemag.com/flight-today/popculture.html|title=Star Quality |date=September 1, 2006|publisher=Air & Space Magazine|accessdate=11 January 2010}}</ref> ''[[Pearl Harbor (film)|Pearl Harbor]]'',<ref name="Persall">{{cite web|url=http://www.sptimes.com/News/052701/news_pf/Floridian/More_romance_than_his.shtml|title=More romance than history|last=Persall|first=Steve|date=May 27, 2001|publisher=St. Petersburg Times|accessdate=11 January 2010}}</ref><ref name="Wilonsky">{{cite web|url=http://www.houstonpress.com/2001-05-24/film/bora-bora-bora/ |title=Bora! Bora! Bora! |last=Wilonsky |first=Robert|date=May 24, 2001|publisher=Houston Press|accessdate=11 January 2010}}</ref> and ''[[Tora! Tora! Tora!]]''.<ref name="Murray">{{cite web|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=wyYhAAAAIBAJ&sjid=ZnoEAAAAIBAJ&pg=2871,98636&dq=zero+tora-tora-tora&hl=en |title=Texas Air Museum Takes Shape |last=Murray |first=Joe |date=June 11, 1990 |publisher=Sarasota Herald-Tribune|pages=11A|accessdate=11 January 2010}}</ref> The Zero was also depicted in the 1976 film ''[[Midway (film)|Midway]]''; however real Zeros were not used. Modified T-6 Texans [[File:Pearl harbor movie poster.jpg|thumb|right|[[North American T-6 Texan|T-6 Texans]] stood in for the A6M Zeros in the movie [[Pearl Harbor (film)|Pearl Harbor]]]]were used in both ''Tora! Tora! Tora!'' and ''Midway'' to depict A6M2 Type 21 Zero fighters, and some footage from the former was reused in the latter.<ref>[http://www.tcm.com/tcmdb/title.jsp?stid=414244&category=Trivia Trivia for Midway(1976)]</ref><ref>[http://www.warbirdinformationexchange.org/wix/wixdownloads.html Warbird Information Exchange - Downloads]</ref><ref>[http://www.december7.com/1941/Classic_Movie_Planes/ TORA, TORA, TORA! I Saw Pearl Harbor Bombed in '69]</ref> One [[Mitsubishi A6M Zero#A6M5 Type 0 Model 52|Type 52]] Zero, reportedly the only airworthy copy in the world, was used in ''Pearl Harbor''.<ref>Bruckheimer, Jerry, Bay, Michael, and Wallace, Randall. ''Pearl Harbor: The Movie and the Moment''. Hyperion, 2001.</ref>

Line 77: Line 81:
==AÃ©rospatiale Gazelle==
==AÃ©rospatiale Gazelle==
  +
[[File:Blue Thunder.jpg|thumb|left|Modified Gazelle on the DVD cover of [[Blue Thunder]]]]
A heavily modified [[AÃ©rospatiale Gazelle|Aerospatiale SA341G Gazelle]] was the center piece in the airborne action film ''[[Blue Thunder]]''. The [[Blue Thunder (helicopter)|same helicopter]] appeared in short-lived TV series by the same name starring [[James Farentino]]. Finally, the modified Gazelle went on to be used in the TV mini-series [[Amerika (TV miniseries)|Amerika]].<ref>[http://www.rotaryaction.com/pages/bluethunder.html Blue Thunder]. Rotary Action site</ref>
A heavily modified [[AÃ©rospatiale Gazelle|Aerospatiale SA341G Gazelle]] was the center piece in the airborne action film ''[[Blue Thunder]]''. The [[Blue Thunder (helicopter)|same helicopter]] appeared in short-lived TV series by the same name starring [[James Farentino]]. Finally, the modified Gazelle went on to be used in the TV mini-series [[Amerika (TV miniseries)|Amerika]].<ref>[http://www.rotaryaction.com/pages/bluethunder.html Blue Thunder]. Rotary Action site</ref>
The Gazelle also a played a role in the TV movie ''Deadly Encounter'' starring [[Larry Hagman]].<ref>[http://www.rotaryaction.com/pages/dlyenctr.html] Rotary Action site</ref>
The Gazelle also a played a role in the TV movie ''Deadly Encounter'' starring [[Larry Hagman]].<ref>[http://www.rotaryaction.com/pages/dlyenctr.html] Rotary Action site</ref>

==AH-64 Apache==
==AH-64 Apache==
  +
[[File:Gunshipscreenshot.png|thumb|left|Cockpit of the AH-64 in the game [[Gunship (video game)|Gunship]]]]
  +
[[File:Firebirdsposter.jpg|thumb|right|AH-64s on the DVD cover of [[Fire Birds]]]]
The [[Boeing AH-64 Apache]] had a major role in the movie ''[[Fire Birds]]'' (or ''Wings of the Apache'').<ref name="Firebirds">{{cite web|url= http://www.optimumreleasing.com/dvd.php?id=261 |title= Wings of the Apache (Firebirds) |accessdate= 11 June 2010 |last= Optimum Releasing |authorlink= |year= 2005}}</ref>
